CHALLENGE.TITLE: The Challenge
CHALLENGE.SUBTITLE: Cities don't stop progressing due to a lack of ideas. They stop due to a lack of structure.

CARDS.TEXT: Without clear institutional architecture, plans fade away.
Without solid financial models, investments don't materialize.
Without strategic coordination and public policy, projects lose continuity.

CHALLENGE.TEXT: Too many urban visions end up filed away.
CHALLENGE.TEXT_2: GLACI exists to bridge that gap between vision and execution.

MODELS.TITLE: Strategic Vision
MODELS.DESCRIPTION: We define the territorial framework, priorities, and roadmap.

MODELS.TITLE: Comprehensive Structuring
MODELS.DESCRIPTION: We design the technical, institutional, and financial architecture.

MODELS.TITLE: Financing
MODELS.DESCRIPTION: We structure public-private schemes and investment mechanisms.

MODELS.TITLE: Coordinated Execution
MODELS.DESCRIPTION: We ensure implementation aligned with results.

ITEMS.TITLE: Are technically, institutionally, and financially viable

DIFFERENTIATION.TITLE: Differentiation
DIFFERENTIATION.SUBTITLE: What sets us apart
ITEMS: Technology without an institutional model fails.
Investment without structure is not executed.
The fragmented city loses its way.
DIFFERENTIATION.TEXT: We integrate vision, governance, and financing into a single strategic framework that enables execution and generates real impact on people's daily lives.

VISION.TITLE: Vision
VISION.TEXT: We promote Smart Cities and Territories with:

CARDS.TITLE: Governance based on data and institutional trust
Coherent public policies that guarantee continuity and execution
Infrastructure managed as an intelligent system
Mobility that connects inclusion and productivity
Resources managed with sustainability and resilience
Innovation as a driver of territorial competitiveness
Skilled human talent prepared to lead the future

AREAS.TITLE: Areas of Impact
AREAS.SUBTITLE: Urban development doesn't happen in isolated parts. It happens when systems connect.
AREAS.TEXT: We work in key areas of urban and territorial development:
AREAS.TEXT_2:
Not as independent solutions,
but as integrated ecosystems.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart
Governance
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Digital Government and Transparency.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION:
Lasting transformations begin with clear decisions, trustworthy institutions, and shared data.
GLACI brings together stakeholders and structures projects to strengthen urban governance sustainably.

AREA1.TITLE: Transparent
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Guarantee open and reliable access to public information through digital tools that strengthen accountability

AREA1.TITLE: Viable over time
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Design citizen participation plans that ensure continuity in projects and public policies beyond administrative cycles

AREA2.TITLE: Participatory
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Promote information and communication technologies so citizens can identify problems and build solutions based on local realities

SERVICE.TITLE: Institutional and multisectoral alignment
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: We create spaces for coordination between institutions, sectors, and key stakeholders to ensure coherence in policies, projects, and development strategies

SERVICE.TITLE: Governance and decision-making models
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: We design governance frameworks that integrate citizen participation, technical evidence, and strategic vision for more legitimate and sustainable decisions

SERVICE.TITLE: Management support platforms and systems
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: We implement digital solutions that facilitate public management, optimize processes, and strengthen institutional response capacity

SERVICE.TITLE: Performance indicators and metrics
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: We define and monitor indicators to evaluate results, measure impact, and guarantee transparency in government management

PROJECTS.TITLE: Digital government and open data platform
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Design and implementation of a comprehensive digital government platform focused on transparency and data-driven decision-making. The project integrates open data portals, strategic indicator dashboards, and public policy monitoring systems, allowing authorities and citizens to access reliable, up-to-date, and actionable information to strengthen accountability and urban management.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Citizen participation and collaborative management system
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of a digital citizen participation ecosystem that allows identifying urban issues, prioritizing projects, and co-creating solutions between government and society. The solution integrates public consultation modules, georeferenced citizen reports, and participation analytics, strengthening the legitimacy of decisions and promoting more inclusive and sustainable urban governance.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart
Economy
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Financing and Business Models.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We promote urban economic models that enable local innovation, digital value chains, and sustainable financing for smart city projects.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_1: We work to make the urban economy:

AREA1.TITLE: Innovation ecosystems
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Promotion of hubs, accelerators, and public-private networks to scale urban solutions based on data and technology.

AREA1.TITLE: Local digital market
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Boosting platforms and digital channels that connect SMEs, local commerce, and public services to increase their competitiveness.

AREA1.TITLE: Sustainable finance
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Design of financial instruments (green bonds, impact-linked loans) to finance smart infrastructure and services.

AREA2.TITLE: Service-based revenue models
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Transition to OpEx/servitization schemes (infrastructure as a service) to reduce barriers to technological adoption.

AREA2.TITLE: Circular economy and employment
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Projects that generate local employment through repair, recycling, and maintenance of smart infrastructure.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: From financial structuring to sustainable operation.

SERVICE.TITLE: Structuring of financial vehicles for cities
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Design of SPVs, co-financing schemes, and public-private partnerships to implement smart projects with clear risk and cash flow.

SERVICE.TITLE: Savings and performance contracting models
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Structuring of projects where savings generated by technology finance the initial investment (efficiency-as-a-service).

SERVICE.TITLE: Urban Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Leasing and subscription solutions for IoT equipment, charging stations, and sensors, reducing the municipality's initial investment.

SERVICE.TITLE: Access to multilateral funds and thematic bonds
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Management to access international financing (development banks, climate funds) aligned with ESG and SDG indicators.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Local urban innovation fund
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Creation and management of a municipal fund that finances mobility, energy, and citizen participation pilots with impact metrics and social return.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Micropayment and local economy platform
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Deployment of a platform to enable digital local commerce, incentives for sustainable consumption, and traceability of social subsidies.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart Mobility &
Infrastructure
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Connected Mobility and Infrastructure.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We manage transportation systems and critical infrastructure with technologies that optimize flow, reduce emissions, and increase safety and accessibility.

AREA1.TITLE: Accessible and connected
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Multimodal integration, real-time information, and universal accessibility for all users.

AREA1.TITLE: Clean and efficient
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Promotion of non-motorized modes, electrified public transport, and sustainable urban logistics.

AREA2.TITLE: Data-driven management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Control and analytics systems to optimize routes, reduce congestion, and prioritize public transport.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: Design, deployment, and operation of connected infrastructure.

SERVICE.TITLE: Adaptive traffic signal control
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Systems that adjust phases in real-time to improve public transport priority and reduce travel times.

SERVICE.TITLE: Smart parking management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Sensors and apps to guide drivers, reduce parking search time, and optimize public space usage.

SERVICE.TITLE: Charging network and electric fleet management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Planning and operation of charging points, demand management, and solutions for municipal fleets.

SERVICE.TITLE: Remotely managed infrastructure
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Lighting and signage systems that reduce consumption and facilitate predictive maintenance.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Urban traffic management system (tms)
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of a management center integrating sensors, analytical CCTV, and predictive models to optimize mobility and incident response.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Pilot network of electric charging stations and e-mobility
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Deployment of strategic charging stations, integration with payment systems, and management of public and private fleets.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart
Environment
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Sustainability and ESG Services.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We design and implement urban environmental systems: monitoring, energy efficiency, water management, and waste management supported by data and governance.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_1: We work to make environmental management:

AREA1.TITLE: Monitored
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Sensor networks for air quality, noise, temperature, and water resources for real-time decision-making.

AREA1.TITLE: Energy efficient
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Efficiency programs, remote management, and electrification with granular consumption measurement.

AREA1.TITLE: Planned and resilient
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Urban planning incorporating climate risks, green spaces, and adaptation to climate change.

AREA2.TITLE: Smart water management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Telemetry, sectorization, and leak detection to ensure efficient supply and reduce losses.

AREA2.TITLE: Smart waste management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Sensors in containers and route optimization to reduce emissions and operational costs.

AREA2.TITLE: Sustainability engagement
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Citizen reporting and education platforms to promote sustainable practices.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: We implement technology with an ESG focus and impact measurement.

SERVICE.TITLE: ESG consulting and climate adaptation
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Assessments, decarbonization plans, and preparation for access to green financing.

SERVICE.TITLE: Smart Water (telemetry and sectorization)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Systems to monitor levels, detect leaks, and prioritize network investments.

SERVICE.TITLE: Emissions inventory and Net Zero strategy
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Measurement, reporting, and planning for GHG reduction with auditable metrics.

SERVICE.TITLE: Air quality monitoring
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Sensor networks with integrations for alerts and public policies.

SERVICE.TITLE: Waste service optimization
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Dynamic routing and data-driven planning for operational efficiency.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Municipal environmental monitoring network
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Deployment of air quality sensors, weather stations, and an open data platform for environmental management and alerts.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Smart water program
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Network sectorization, well telemetry, and an early leak detection system to reduce non-revenue water losses.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart Habitat &
Services
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Safety and Quality of Life.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We promote networks and infrastructures that enhance quality of life: connected health, public space management, and people-centered urban services.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_1: We work to make the habitat:

AREA1.TITLE: Connected health (e-health)
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Telemedicine, remote monitoring, and coordination between centers to improve access to care.

AREA1.TITLE: Digital culture and tourism
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Platforms for cultural experiences, smart routes, and visitor management.

AREA1.TITLE: Efficient public space management
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Predictive maintenance, automated irrigation, and connected furniture to improve use and safety.

AREA2.TITLE: Safety and resilience
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Integrated analytical surveillance systems, early warnings, and response coordination.

AREA2.TITLE: Accessibility and inclusive services
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Kiosks, apps, and services adapted for vulnerable groups and the elderly.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: Solutions focused on the urban experience and equity.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE_SERVICE: Services focused on daily well-being and safety

SERVICE.TITLE: Command and control centers (C2)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Integration of analytical video surveillance, urban sensors, and incident management.

SERVICE.TITLE: Smart parks and public spaces
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Adaptive lighting, automated irrigation, and connected furniture for safety and efficient use.

SERVICE.TITLE: Infrastructure monitoring and civil protection
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Structural sensors and alert systems for risk management and maintenance.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Municipal telemedicine center
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of health kiosks connected to regional hospitals for primary care and remote monitoring of chronic patients.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Smart wellness park
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Transformation of an urban park with adaptive lighting, efficient irrigation, usage sensors, and solar charging stations for citizen devices.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart
Society
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Society and Digital Inclusion.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We promote digital inclusion, education, and citizen participation through platforms and programs that bring technology closer to all people.

AREA1.TITLE: Inclusive
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Digital access for vulnerable populations and programs to reduce the digital divide.

AREA1.TITLE: Skilled
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Training programs in digital and STEM skills for local employment.

AREA1.TITLE: Creative and participatory
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Platforms that foster the co-creation of public policies and projects.

AREA2.TITLE: Community networks
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Support for local initiatives and platforms for coordinating civil organizations.

AREA2.TITLE: Lifelong digital education
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Connected classrooms and resources for distance learning and continuous training.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: Technology with a human face and inclusive approach.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE_SERVICE: Technology with a human face and inclusive approach

SERVICE.TITLE: Community connectivity deployment
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Public access points, infrastructure for telecenters, and mesh networks in areas with low connectivity.

SERVICE.TITLE: Accessible platforms and services
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Design of inclusive interfaces and service channels adapted for people with disabilities.

SERVICE.TITLE: STEM training centers
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Labs and robotics/programming programs for students and local entrepreneurs.

SERVICE.TITLE: Social teleservices
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Kiosks and applications for administrative procedures, basic health, and employment services in remote areas.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Community digital inclusion program
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Network of telecenters and Wi-Fi points managed by the municipality for digital literacy, online procedures, and support for local SMEs.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Citizen participation platform
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Digital tool for public consultations, participatory budgeting, and commitment tracking, with dashboards for transparency.

HERO.TEXT_1: We structure and execute people-centered Smart City projects.
HERO.TEXT_1_1: We are a strategic consortium that integrates urban vision, financial structuring, and coordinated execution to develop viable, funded, and sustainable projects.

ABOUT.LABEL: Smart City.
ABOUT.TEXT1: A holistic system where human and social capital interact, employing ICT-based solutions.
ABOUT.TITLE2: The purpose of a Smart City is to achieve efficient management
ABOUT.TEXT2: meeting the needs of the city and its citizens.
ABOUT.TITLE3: Consulting and advisory in smart city management
ABOUT.TEXT3: National and international services with an ethical, sustainable, and innovative approach.

CONTACT_FORM.HEADING: Contact us if you have questions or comments about the topic, or register to receive more information about smart cities.

INFORMATION.MISSION_TEXT: To devise smart solutions for the technological and sustainable development of cities and communities, always seeking the inclusion and accessibility of people.
INFORMATION.VISION_TEXT: To develop and create city and human settlement projects worldwide that promote inclusiveness and guarantee accessibility, safety, resource optimization, affordability, and sustainability to achieve prosperity and quality of life.

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Smart City – Smart Communities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
GLACI Smart Cities, Smart Future supports the management and implementation processes of solutions based on ISO standards.

These allow for the objective evaluation of the development of sustainable cities and communities, through process standardization and with a qualitative and quantitative analysis.
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT: The International Organization for Standardization, through its technical committee 268 for sustainable cities and communities, has developed the following Standards in this field of application.

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable development in communities - Management System for Sustainable Development
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
Its main goals are:

  • Build consensus for sustainable development
  • Improve the sustainability, smartness, and resilience of all its actions
  • Develop intersectoral, multidisciplinary, life cycle value, and total costing approaches.
  • Foster synergies
  • Increase efficiency and attractiveness of communities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Scope:

  • Applicable to communities of all sizes, structures, and types
  • Applicable to developed and developing countries
  • Applicable at local, regional, or national level
  • Applicable in urban or rural areas

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable development of communities – Indicators for city services and quality of life
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
This standard complements the series of indicators for measuring performance in communities; it includes city services and quality of life in smart cities and resilient cities.

These indicators allow evaluation and planning based on potential future needs and establish as main goals:

  • Measurement of service performance and quality management over time
  • Possibility of comparison to learn about performance measures
  • Policy development and priority setting
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Scope:

  • Indicators aggregable to very large administrative areas
  • Applicable to assessing the efficiency of city resources
  • Together with other indicators, it allows for a more comprehensive and holistic approach to sustainability analysis

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable cities and communities - Indicators for Smart Cities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
It presents a benchmark for city sustainability, which requires additional indicators to those established for evaluating city services and quality of life. In conjunction with the application of ISO 37120, it helps cities implement policies, programs, and projects for smart cities.

Scope:

Together with ISO 37120, it aims to provide a complete set of indicators to measure progress towards a smart city.
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Its goals are:

  • Apply collaborative leadership methods
  • Use data information and technologies to improve services and quality of life
  • Provide a better living environment through smart policies and making technologies available to citizens
  • Generate innovative solutions to environmental and sustainability issues
  • Identify needs and benefits of smart infrastructure
  • Facilitate innovation and growth
  • Build a dynamic and innovative economy that manages to be resilient

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable Cities and Communities – Indicators for Resilient Cities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
A resilient city is capable of preparing for, recovering from, and adapting to shocks and stresses. This standard, together with the indicators outlined in ISO 37120, allows for the evaluation of Resilient Cities and also for taking actions to manage and mitigate human and natural stress related to environmental degradation and economic instability that cause persistent negative impacts.

It presents specific indicators and also structured indicators according to a risk management and disaster management process; monitoring compliance with Sustainable Development Goals and structured in accordance with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction, these aim to help cities:
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
• Prepare for, recover from, and adapt to shocks and stresses
  • Generate learning based on comparing performance measures and sharing good practices.


Scope:

  • Applicable for measuring resilience in cities
  • Applicable to any city, municipality, or local government
  • Applicable regardless of size or location

REGISTER_INFORMATION.TITLE:
Do you need
information?
REGISTER_INFORMATION.SUBTITLE:
At GLACI
we are at your service.
REGISTER_INFORMATION.TEXT: If you are interested in learning more about the topic or if you have any questions or suggestions, we invite you to fill out the registration form with real data so we can communicate correctly and provide you with the tools and information you need.
REGISTER_INFORMATION.WARNING: * Rest assured that your data will be handled securely.

FORM.TITLE: register to request information about a topic of your interest.
FORM.SUBTITLE: Your registration helps us send you the necessary data you request.

GLACI.TITLE: What it is
GLACI.DESCRIPTION: GLACI is a strategic consortium specialized in structuring and executing Smart City and Territory projects.
GLACI.TEXT_1: We are not just another piece in the process. We are the framework that aligns vision, technical capacity, and financing under a single strategic architecture.
GLACI.TEXT_2: We integrate high-level strategic talent under a single direction to transform urban complexity into structured, financeable, and executable projects.

CARDS.TITLE: Deep understanding
CARDS.TEXT: We listen to the territory, its stakeholders, and its real context.

CARDS.TITLE: Co-creation and structuring
CARDS.TEXT: We align sectors and design solid technical and financial structures.

CARDS.TITLE: Responsible materialization
CARDS.TEXT: We accompany execution with governance, metrics, and continuity.

WORK.TITLE: We collaborate with
WORK.SUB_TEXT: We act as the structuring partner and coordinator of the comprehensive project.
WORK.TEXT_2: Our approach aligns with international standards and best practices for sustainable and smart cities, prioritizing governance, indicators, transparency, and continuity.

CONSORTIUM.TITLE: Consortium
CONSORTIUM.TEXT: GLACI is a consortium formed by professionals, organizations, and strategic allies with real experience in urban development, infrastructure, sustainability, finance, and knowledge.
CONSORTIUM.TEXT_2: We believe that major urban challenges are not solved from a single sector.
CONSORTIUM.TEXT_3: They are solved through conscious collaboration.

GOVERNANCE.SUBTITLE: Lasting transformations begin with clear decisions, trustworthy institutions, and shared data.
GOVERNANCE.TEXT_1: GLACI brings together stakeholders and structures projects to strengthen urban governance sustainably.
GOVERNANCE.TEXT_4_1: We have supported urban and territorial projects where governance was key to ensuring continuity, trust, and measurable results.

TEAM.TITLE: Talent
TEAM.SUBTITLE: Behind every project there are people.
TEAM.TEXT_2: Our team combines knowledge, judgment, and responsibility.

TEAM.NAME: Osvaldo Mireles
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Expert in technology and sustainable development with specialization in Smart Cities, BIM, Blockchain, AI, and the New Urban Agenda.

TEAM.NAME: Hugo Isaak
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Expert in smart cities with over 17 years of experience in public administration, specialized in smart cities, sustainable habitat, and artificial intelligence.

TEAM.NAME: Ignasi Pérez Arnal
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Pioneer of BIM in Europe, co-founder of BIM Academy Spain and creator of the EUROPEAN BIM SUMMIT. He is director of The Rebuild, a leading event in advanced construction and architecture in Spain. Additionally, he leads BIM and digital transformation training at prominent institutions, driving innovative projects in sustainability and urban planning.

TEAM.NAME: Jorge Moreno Vargas
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Expert in disruptive technologies, MIT Certified. 13 years leading innovation in smart cities, IoT, and sustainable projects.

TEAM.NAME: Héctor Miranda Martínez
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Expert in land road construction with extensive experience in planning, execution, and quality control in infrastructure projects in the public and industrial sectors.

TEAM.NAME: Tania Sánchez
TEAM.POSITION: Director of Sustainable Architecture and Urbanism
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Senior architect and urban planner with national and international experience. Specialized in sustainable urban design and planning.

TEAM.NAME: Guillermo Sánchez
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: PhD Architect in Urban and Regional Planning, with over 20 years of international experience in developing urban, metropolitan, and regional strategies, as well as researching urban and territorial processes. Expert in strategic city planning.

TEAM.NAME: Angel Luis Tendero
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Architect and project manager. A reference in architecture, he has been featured on the covers of ABC, El Mundo, and El País for his career.

TEAM.NAME: Yuka Nakasone
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: With over 30 years of experience in international business, she stands out for her ability to help organizations adapt and thrive in the digital and global era. Originally from Japan and based in Barcelona, she is known for her deep knowledge of innovation and technology.

TEAM.NAME: Amaia Celaya Alvarez
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Urban Resilience Advisor, expert in designing resilient cities and managing urban risks.

TEAM.NAME: Ernesto Valdés
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Psychologist trained in Costa Rica and Mexico, with diplomas in AI and Digital Transformation. Innovator in smart and sustainable cities, co-founder of Neurabitat.

TEAM.NAME: Montserrat Armengol Aragonès
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Founding partner and manager of Coloma+Armengol, a consulting and training firm specialized in technological innovation processes in the construction sector. Coordinator of the Master in BIM Management.

TEAM.NAME: Eloi Coloma
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: PhD Architect specialized in BIM and digital transformation. Professor and researcher at the Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPC).

TEAM.NAME: Gerardo Velasco Gutierrez
TEAM.POSITION: General Director MEM and Co-founder of XPLORADN
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: He has led more than 165 investment projects and strategic roles in regional planning and development, contributing to emblematic initiatives such as the World Bank's innovation loans and the National Fisheries Plan. Founder of XPLORADN, expert in sustainable financial strategies and innovative development.

TEAM.NAME: Francisco Flores
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Emerging Futures Designer, consultant, and expert in urban labs, citizen science, and grassroots innovation processes. Promoter of the Fab City León initiative, which belongs to a global movement of sustainable cities promoting an urban-industrial paradigm shift.

AREAS_2.TITLE: Areas of Impact
AREAS_2.SUBTITLE: Urban development doesn't happen in isolated parts. It happens when systems connect.
AREAS_2.TEXT: We work in key areas of urban and territorial development:
AREAS_2.TEXT_2: Not as independent solutions, but as integrated ecosystems.

AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Multimodal integration, real-time information, and universal accessibility for all users.

AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Promotion of non-motorized modes, electrified public transport, and sustainable urban logistics.

AREA2.TITLE: Data-driven management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Control and analytics systems to optimize routes, reduce congestion, and prioritize public transport.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: Design, deployment, and operation of connected infrastructure.

SERVICE.TITLE: Adaptive traffic signal control
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Systems that adjust phases in real-time to improve public transport priority and reduce travel times.

SERVICE.TITLE: Smart parking management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Sensors and apps to guide drivers, reduce parking search time, and optimize public space usage.

SERVICE.TITLE: Charging network and electric fleet management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Planning and operation of charging points, demand management, and solutions for municipal fleets.

SERVICE.TITLE: Remotely managed infrastructure
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Lighting and signage systems that reduce consumption and facilitate predictive maintenance.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Urban traffic management system (tms)
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of a management center integrating sensors, analytical CCTV, and predictive models to optimize mobility and incident response.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Pilot network of electric charging stations and e-mobility
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Deployment of strategic charging stations, integration with payment systems, and management of public and private fleets.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart
Environment
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Sustainability and ESG Services.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We design and implement urban environmental systems: monitoring, energy efficiency, water management, and waste management supported by data and governance.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_1: We work to make environmental management:

AREA1.TITLE: Monitored
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Sensor networks for air quality, noise, temperature, and water resources for real-time decision-making.

AREA1.TITLE: Energy efficient
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Efficiency programs, remote management, and electrification with granular consumption measurement.

AREA1.TITLE: Planned and resilient
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Urban planning incorporating climate risks, green spaces, and adaptation to climate change.

AREA2.TITLE: Smart water management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Telemetry, sectorization, and leak detection to ensure efficient supply and reduce losses.

AREA2.TITLE: Smart waste management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Sensors in containers and route optimization to reduce emissions and operational costs.

AREA2.TITLE: Sustainability engagement
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Citizen reporting and education platforms to promote sustainable practices.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: We implement technology with an ESG focus and impact measurement.

SERVICE.TITLE: ESG consulting and climate adaptation
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Assessments, decarbonization plans, and preparation for access to green financing.

SERVICE.TITLE: Smart Water (telemetry and sectorization)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Systems to monitor levels, detect leaks, and prioritize network investments.

SERVICE.TITLE: Emissions inventory and Net Zero strategy
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Measurement, reporting, and planning for GHG reduction with auditable metrics.

SERVICE.TITLE: Air quality monitoring
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Sensor networks with integrations for alerts and public policies.

SERVICE.TITLE: Waste service optimization
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Dynamic routing and data-driven planning for operational efficiency.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Municipal environmental monitoring network
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Deployment of air quality sensors, weather stations, and an open data platform for environmental management and alerts.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Smart water program
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Network sectorization, well telemetry, and an early leak detection system to reduce non-revenue water losses.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart Habitat &
Services
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Safety and Quality of Life.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We promote networks and infrastructures that enhance quality of life: connected health, public space management, and people-centered urban services.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_1: We work to make the habitat:

AREA1.TITLE: Connected health (e-health)
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Telemedicine, remote monitoring, and coordination between centers to improve access to care.

AREA1.TITLE: Digital culture and tourism
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Platforms for cultural experiences, smart routes, and visitor management.

AREA1.TITLE: Efficient public space management
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Predictive maintenance, automated irrigation, and connected furniture to improve use and safety.

AREA2.TITLE: Safety and resilience
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Integrated analytical surveillance systems, early warnings, and response coordination.

AREA2.TITLE: Accessibility and inclusive services
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Kiosks, apps, and services adapted for vulnerable groups and the elderly.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: Solutions focused on the urban experience and equity.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE_SERVICE: Services focused on daily well-being and safety

SERVICE.TITLE: Command and control centers (C2)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Integration of analytical video surveillance, urban sensors, and incident management.

SERVICE.TITLE: Smart parks and public spaces
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Adaptive lighting, automated irrigation, and connected furniture for safety and efficient use.

SERVICE.TITLE: Infrastructure monitoring and civil protection
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Structural sensors and alert systems for risk management and maintenance.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Municipal telemedicine center
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of health kiosks connected to regional hospitals for primary care and remote monitoring of chronic patients.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Smart wellness park
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Transformation of an urban park with adaptive lighting, efficient irrigation, usage sensors, and solar charging stations for citizen devices.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart
Society
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Society and Digital Inclusion.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We promote digital inclusion, education, and citizen participation through platforms and programs that bring technology closer to all people.

AREA1.TITLE: Inclusive
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Digital access for vulnerable populations and programs to reduce the digital divide.

AREA1.TITLE: Skilled
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Training programs in digital and STEM skills for local employment.

AREA1.TITLE: Creative and participatory
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Platforms that foster the co-creation of public policies and projects.

AREA2.TITLE: Community networks
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Support for local initiatives and platforms for coordinating civil organizations.

AREA2.TITLE: Lifelong digital education
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Connected classrooms and resources for distance learning and continuous training.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.AREA_TEXT_2: Technology with a human face and inclusive approach.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE_SERVICE: Technology with a human face and inclusive approach

SERVICE.TITLE: Community connectivity deployment
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Public access points, infrastructure for telecenters, and mesh networks in areas with low connectivity.

SERVICE.TITLE: Accessible platforms and services
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Design of inclusive interfaces and service channels adapted for people with disabilities.

SERVICE.TITLE: STEM training centers
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Labs and robotics/programming programs for students and local entrepreneurs.

SERVICE.TITLE: Social teleservices
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Kiosks and applications for administrative procedures, basic health, and employment services in remote areas.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Community digital inclusion program
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Network of telecenters and Wi-Fi points managed by the municipality for digital literacy, online procedures, and support for local SMEs.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Citizen participation platform
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Digital tool for public consultations, participatory budgeting, and commitment tracking, with dashboards for transparency.
